{\LARGE \textbf{Calculus I - Final Exam Cheat Sheet}}
\par\vspace{0.1em}

\par\vspace{0.3em}

\section{Limits}

$\lim_(x \to a) f(x) = L$ means $\forall \epsilon > 0, \exists \delta > 0$ s.t. $|x - a| < \delta \Rightarrow |f(x) - L| < \epsilon$

\subsection{Key Limits}

\begin{itemize}
  \item  \[
\lim_(x \to 0) (sin x)/x = 1
\]
  \item  \[
\lim_(x \to 0) (1 - cos x)/x = 0
\]
  \item  \[
\lim_(x \to infinity) (1 + 1/n)^n = e
\]
  \item  \[
\lim_(x \to 0) (e^x - 1)/x = 1
\]
\end{itemize}

\subsection{L'H么pital's Rule}

If $\lim f(x)/g(x) = 0/0$ or $infinity/infinity$:

\[
\lim_(x \to a) f(x)/g(x) = \lim_(x \to a) (f'(x))/(g'(x))
\]

\section{Derivatives}

\subsection{Basic Rules}

$(f g)' = f' g + f g'$ \\ $(f/g)' = (f' g - f g')/g^2$ \\ $(f compose g)' = f'(g(x)) dot g'(x)$

\subsection{Common Derivatives}

{\small $d/(d x) x^n = n x^(n-1)$ $d/(d x) e^x = e^x$ $d/(d x) ln x = 1/x$ $d/(d x) a^x = a^x ln a$ $d/(d x) sin x = cos x$ $d/(d x) cos x = -sin x$ $d/(d x) tan x = sec^2 x$ $d/(d x) sec x = sec x tan x$ $d/(d x) arcsin x = 1/\sqrt{1-x^2}$ $d/(d x) arctan x = 1/(1+x^2)$ }

\subsection{Implicit Differentiation}

\begin{enumerate}
  \item Differentiate both sides w.r.t. $x$
  \item Apply chain rule: $d/(d x) y = (d y)/(d x)$
  \item Solve for $d y \/ d x$
\end{enumerate}

\section{Integrals}

\subsection{Basic Forms}

$\int x^n d x = x^(n+1)/(n+1) + C$ (for $n eq.not -1$) \\ $\int 1/x d x = ln|x| + C$ \\ $\int e^x d x = e^x + C$

\subsection{Trig Integrals}

{\small $\int sin x d x = -cos x + C$ $\int cos x d x = sin x + C$ $\int sec^2 x d x = tan x + C$ $\int sec x tan x d x = sec x + C$ }

\subsection{Integration Techniques}

\textbf{u-Substitution:} $\int f(g(x)) g'(x) d x = \int f(u) d u$

\textbf{By Parts:} $\int u d v = u v - \int v d u$

\textbf{LIATE Rule:} Choose $u$ in order: Log, Inverse trig, Algebraic, Trig, Exponential

\subsection{Definite Integrals}

\[
\int_a^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)
\]

\textbf{Properties:}

\begin{itemize}
  \item  \[
\int_a^b f + g = \int_a^b f + \int_a^b g
\]
  \item  \[
\int_a^b c f = c \int_a^b f
\]
  \item  \[
\int_a^b f = -\int_b^a f
\]
\end{itemize}

\section{Applications}

\subsection{Area Between Curves}

\[
A = \int_a^b |f(x) - g(x)| d x
\]

\subsection{Volume of Revolution}

\textbf{Disk Method:} $V = \pi \int_a^b [f(x)]^2 d x$

\textbf{Washer:} $V = \pi \int_a^b ([R(x)]^2 - [r(x)]^2) d x$

\textbf{Shell:} $V = 2 \pi \int_a^b x f(x) d x$

\subsection{Arc Length}

\[
L = \int_a^b sqrt(1 + [f'(x)]^2) d x
\]

\section{Series}

\subsection{Geometric Series}

$\sum_(n=0)^infinity a r^n = a/(1-r)$ for $|r| < 1$

\subsection{Taylor Series}

\[
f(x) = \sum_(n=0)^infinity (f^((n))(a))/(n!) (x-a)^n
\]

\subsection{Common Series}

\begin{itemize}
  \item  \[
e^x = \sum_(n=0)^infinity x^n / n!
\]
  \item  \[
sin x = \sum_(n=0)^infinity (-1)^n x^(2n+1) / (2n+1)!
\]
  \item  \[
cos x = \sum_(n=0)^infinity (-1)^n x^(2n) / (2n)!
\]
  \item $1/(1-x) = \sum_(n=0)^infinity x^n$ for $|x| < 1$
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Convergence Tests}

\begin{itemize}
  \item \textbf{Ratio:} $\lim |a_(n+1)/a_n| < 1 \Rightarrow$ converges
  \item \textbf{Root:} $\lim root(n, |a_n|) < 1 \Rightarrow$ converges
  \item \textbf{Integral:} $\int_1^infinity f(x) d x$ converges $\Leftrightarrow$ series converges
  \item \textbf{Comparison:} Compare to known series
  \item \textbf{Alternating:} $a_n$ decreasing, $\lim a_n = 0 \Rightarrow$ converges
\end{itemize}

\section{Quick Reference}

\subsection{Trig Identities}

\begin{itemize}
  \item  \[
sin^2 x + cos^2 x = 1
\]
  \item  \[
1 + tan^2 x = sec^2 x
\]
  \item  \[
sin 2x = 2 sin x cos x
\]
  \item  \[
cos 2x = cos^2 x - sin^2 x
\]
\end{itemize}

\subsection{Useful Values}

{\small $\theta$ $sin$ $cos$ $tan$ $0$ $0$ $1$ $0$ $\pi/6$ $1/2$ $\sqrt{3}/2$ $1/\sqrt{3}$ $\pi/4$ $\sqrt{2}/2$ $\sqrt{2}/2$ $1$ $\pi/3$ $\sqrt{3}/2$ $1/2$ $\sqrt{3}$ $\pi/2$ $1$ $0$ undef }
